document_data.name: Jhaamdathan
document_data.influences: [[Giant language|Jotun]]<ref group="note">''[[Giantcraft]]'' describes Jotun as a progenitor of [[Thorass language|Thorass]]. As Thorass is clearly described as resulting from Jhaamdathan and [[Alzhedo]], and Alzhedo was derived from [[Auran]], Jotun must also be a progenitor of Jhaamdathan.
document_data.mainbody:
'''Jhaamdathan''' was the language of the old [[Jhaamdath]]an Empire.<ref name=RoF-p85>

Jhaamdathan was also known as "'''Old Chondathan'''", and as this name suggests, it was the direct precursor of the [[Chondathan language]].<ref name=RoF-p86> The original "Common" tongue, [[Thorass language|Thorass]] ("Old Common"), came about as a mixture of Jhaamdathan and [[Alzhedo]], and thus, Jhaamdathan was a progenitor of modern [[Common]] as well.<ref name=RoF-p85/>

Jhaamdathan's progenitors included [[Giant language|Jotun]], the language of giants.<ref name=Giantcraft>
